website_summaries.verdict: Exceptionally long rope toy with five knots, that's great for large dogs.
pros: One of the longest rope toys available, at 72-inches in length
With such a long rope, multiple dogs can play a game of tug together
Consists of a 100% natural cotton fiber, so it's safe to use with dogs who like to chew
Multiple knots let the dog gain a tight grip
cons: Rope is almost too long to use as a fetch toy

customer_reviews.title: My Pup's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd puppy loves this rope! It is his favorite toy. At 9 months old and 70 pounds he needs a constant supply of substantial things to chew on. This provides him hours of entertainment and I don't worry about his teeth as with some of his other power chewer toys that feel as hard as concrete. Playing tug-o-war is great family fun and it is hilarious to watch him carry this thing all over the house :) The 36" size is perfect for a large dog in my opinion. I am VERY happy with this purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: TLK

customer_reviews.title: these have been great for me
customer_reviews.text: this is an all around great product if you don't mind picking up all the little pieces off the floor. super safe, no supervision required. I believe it does some work at cleaning the teeth. these ropes have helped me out a lot. highly recommended for energetic dogs. watch the video for a detailed review. check me out on YouTube for more product reviews and interesting videos. This is the Midwest Man. See Ya!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest ManTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for power chewers, tugmasters
customer_reviews.text: My dog goes through toys how a lawnmower goes through grass. I can't tell you how many times she chewed up a new expensive toy within an hour. This is good for fetch or tug or just to gnaw. I've had it a week and it shows no wear. Its thicker and much less expensive than similar toys at PetSmart.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Nahman

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but good things to say about this rope toy. I've got 2 large breed dogs and both of them are big heavy duty chewers. It's been months now and sure some strands have come off and it's frayed some in spots but it's still intact and going strong. This will be the only brand rope I buy my girls from now on as it's been the only one to make it more than a week between the 2 of them. It's long enough for both of them to grab an end and play tug of war with plenty of room to spare and they love whipping it around. Happy fur babies make me a happy fur mom
customer_reviews.author: bctaccone

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love these ropes! I buy them often because I have a 45lb pitbull and a 60lb Husky I usually try to keep around 4 available at all times that way they dont focus on destroying one. With keeping that many around they would last a couple months with my power chewers. I usually purchase a couple each month to have around as back up. If you have a power chewer make sure you get the 5 knot XL as the smaller ones won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: ... dogs but being as they are both REALLY REALLY good with their puppy faces
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a Christmas gift for my two dogs but being as they are both REALLY REALLY good with their puppy faces, I gave them this one early and they love to play with it individually or together. I will warn you that you may want this to be an outside only toy or a basement toy because it could really do some damage if you have a TV, picture frames or anything breakable on a dog level. My dogs swing this around like nuts so we had to quarantine the toy to the basement but they enjoy it just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Lia Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good rope for the money
customer_reviews.text: My two large dogs destroy everything super quickly. I do not expect these ropes or anything else to last very long, I have no illusion buying these that they will not have it in shreds in a day or two. Luckily they don’t eat it so ropes are safe for them. This was great for a couple days of tugging and playing then I swept it up after they were done pulling it apart. It did it’s job, we had tons of fun.
customer_reviews.author: jaz

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Teething Puppy
customer_reviews.text: This rope is longer than my arm from shoulder to fingertips! I have a 40 pound German Shepherd puppy and it's not to big for her. She loves it and so do I since it helps with play and saves my fingers! Nice long rope means when she's grabbing and tugging there's some distance from her teeth to my hands. If you have a large breed puppy or dog you'll be glad you bought this as well. This is great for a teething puppy or a dog who just loves to tug on ropes.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa65Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It’s lasting!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a heavy chewer. She’s destroyed countless shoes, bras, and toys. She’s also stuck inside the house for hours at a time when I get scheduled on days her “daddy” has to work as well. So she needs a good toy to keep herself occupied. Enter...XL Rope Toy. She’s really good about destroying rope toys, but so far, she hasn’t ruined it! It does have some frays, but typically she can break them in a day or two. After two weeks, this toy has stood her tests and she just runs around or plays tug of war with it. It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: BEST Dog toy ever for a large puppy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this six stars. My Great Pyrenees puppy LOVES this 5-know rope. Keep in mind, this is a thick, huge rope. I was surprised how big it is. It has held up several weeks now, and is the best dog toy I've bought yet (I bought sixty dollars worth of toys, and this quickly rose to the top as #1). We keep it inside so it doesn't get super dirty, and I play with her almost every day with this rope.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Meade

customer_reviews.title: For the price I don't think you can find better. Its huge Thick and Long great quality
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs love to play tug. They are 12mo 120lb still in that puppy stage and Needed something they could beat up together & chew that could last. Everything I have gotten has been expensive and has not lasted very long. The price of this rope is very reasonable based on the size. Its huge and way better quality than i expected. The label clearly states warning"Do not allow your dog to swallow rope or parts of the rope" I would suggest once the rope gets beat up retie new knots and cut off frailed parts to extent the life and safety. Anyone giving this toy a poor review has severe mental health problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Good quality / great value toy
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet found any 'indestructible' rope toy. Be aware, that this can be ripped and shredded, particularly if your dog likes to chew/gnaw on the rope (as opposed to just playing catch or tug of war with it) --- which is also true of any other rope toy I have yet seen. But, this is very thick, and, the quality is as good as any other rope toy we've come across. The length is great for a medium/large dog, but, it would likely be much too big for a smaller dog. For the price, this is an outstanding value.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlitestorm

customer_reviews.title: Big rope toy for big time fun.
customer_reviews.text: This rope is long and thick, so much so that it is very entertaining to watch my 50-pound Border Collie mix play with it in the yard. I will peak out the back window and see her dragging and swinging that thing around; generally keeping herself entertained and not digging holes in the yard. I am pleased with the quality of the rope and, after a few months, the durability so far. Our previous rope/tennis ball combo toy barely lasted the summer so we'll see how this toy holds up in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great rope! Heavy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Ropes awesome! I got the 72inch one and its long enough for me to be in the middle and play with both my dogs at the same time. Ropes heavy and durable too. Its actually heavy to the point where if you have a large dog like I do (half pit half lab), when he goes bananas and starts swinging it every direction known to man in a frenzy, if you let you and get whacked, its gonna hurt! But that's a plus for me, work on them reflexes. Be warned though, just because the rope is 6 feet, your dog WILL STILL GRAB IT a foot or two away from your hand haha
customer_reviews.author: AznMikeD

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how long this is, and how great the price was. Our dog LOVES it (Rott puppy). She hasn't destroyed it yet, but I'd buy another one if she did. They aren't meant to last forever, but are great and long-lasting chew toys. We love playing tug without having to bend over or risk our hands getting bit (clumsy puppy). Also, this came in a 5-foot-tall box. No problem, but gave us a good laugh when we saw the box at our front door and tried to think what we could have possibly bought that would be that big! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Great workout and keeps dog teeth very clean.
customer_reviews.text: My sled dog needs lots of exercise. Her favorite play time with me is to tug on the big rope until I get it away from her and then gather it up and throw it. Since it is relatively heavy she has to drag it back to play tug some more. We do this every day until she just lays down from exhaustion. The vet is always amazed that her teeth are so clean since I never have to brush them, totally free of any plack. The rope lasts a long time, and then I order a new one. Good quality soft rope obviously made for dogs to play with. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Held up quite awhile
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this June 5 2015 and received it a few days later. Our golden is a monster chewer and just last night shredded the end. Most toys last a day maybe 2. So fairly impressed with how long its held up!!
customer_reviews.author: JK218

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy chewers who want the satisfaction of destroying something (aka not rubber)
customer_reviews.text: So far this is the only toy to stand its ground with my heavy chewer 80 lb pit bull / lab mix. My dog loves to have the satisfaction of tearing something up, so she gets bored with Kong toys. This rope toy is perfect because it lasts about 1-3 months until she starts pulling out too many strings and it's time to get a new one. For comparison, other toys marketed toward heavy chewers have lasted only a day or two. This rope toy is also great for tug of war. I like the knots because they keep her teeth away from my hands and gives me something to hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality & great price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our two dogs -a senior Labrador and an 8 month old / 25lb mix. They love it. It's sturdy enough for a good game of tug between human and canine and has held up well when the puppy chews on it. That said, I'm sure a larger or more determined dog (or even our puppy given enough time) can chew through it. However, for the price I'm thrilled with the quality. We will be buying more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: AJ'sMomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very good value even for a heavy chewer
customer_reviews.text: I bought a very similar one from Wally World (same brand), for our 80lb still growing puppy and it wasn't long until he had it chewed in half. I've had this one since 13th August and it is still in one length. Although two parts have almost been chewed through, it is definitely holding up. It will certainly last longer than the other one did. I lucked out and got Alabama colors too... LOL I'm very pleased with this brand, and will by again. Our dog is a very heavy chewer, so even when he does chew through it, we'll have two separate lengths. We'll hid the other one until he's annihilated one half. They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki JS

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be really tough & rugged for strong dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Ok mind you we’ve only had this product about 5 or 6 days.... but I am so far so happy with this purchase. My dog loves these tug o war rope toys. However usually, the rope is destroyed immediately by her sharp canine teeth. So far this one seems really rugged and I have yet to notice it falling apart. I’m really hoping this lasts longer than a month or two. The only one we’ve had last a year had to finally be thrown away after it completely unraveled.
customer_reviews.author: AimarooniTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Made a bit of a mess to clean up but the dogs did enjoy tugging with it and playing keep away
customer_reviews.text: This lasted much longer than my large flossy chew 3 knot. The 5 knot XL was much thicker and harder for my excessive chewer to cut through immediately. Even left it outside for the dogs to play with which gave them something else to do than dig up my yard. Lasted a few weeks until I went out one day and the yard was rope bombed with rope threads everywhere. Made a bit of a mess to clean up but the dogs did enjoy tugging with it and playing keep away. As always be sure to clean up any threads that the dogs might shred off. Rope fibers can be dangerous if ingested.
customer_reviews.author: JordanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: XL is So much fun for big active dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My extremely active and agile 60lb puppy lives this toy. I wear it over my shoulders when I run her and on the way home we get sweaty with a game of tug of war. I spin it around my head and she chases it. Watch the video, she spins 360. She loves it, and it is also a great training tool. She's learning to sit and stop playing when I tell her.
customer_reviews.author: Damage98

customer_reviews.title: Longer than it looks in the picture!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my LARGE dog! And it is strong. He is an aggressive chewer and tends to eat fabric so I won't leave him alone with it. But all toys are mine and he gets to choose a different one every day. :-) And he chooses this one first every time! If I have time to tug with him he gets so excited. The multiple knots keep him from accidentally grabbing my hand with his large teeth. Well worth the great price!!
customer_reviews.author: Compltlyme

customer_reviews.title: Great Rope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at a retail store, but glad to see Amazon has them. My 14 month old Golden loves the 72 inch. yes, it is long. She cannot have the 3 knot ones because she chews them instantly and destroys the ends. However, because it is long, she is detracted from chewing the longer tuft ends. It is also tightly wound and the knots are a decent size . She will have this one for a while. You will find pieces that fall off around your house too especially the tuft ends , but that's a small price to pay for a dog's happiness and health.
customer_reviews.author: Tigger 74

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a bull terrier and a dalmatian that usually go through one rope toy a month for their tug of war sessions, but THIS rope only lasted two days. I've purchased other ropes of the same size on amazon and they usually last a month. This one just fell apart. I would only suggest this for small dogs. Don't buy if you have a large dog or puppy; not for heavy chewers. The strings also started to quick unravel near the ends and had to worry about dog eating them, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Really long length and durable. Our shepherds love them.
customer_reviews.text: These are crazy nice for the price! Our shepherds love them. They're really long and heavy. Good for tug of war and our dogs like to shred them over time, but that usually takes months. They are made of tons of soft string, but are surprisingly tough. Our dogs will chew through the long parts and the knots will stick around even longer. Our dogs do make a bit of a mess with the strings near the end, but it's easy clean up. We order these every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: This tug toy probably deserves four stars, but I'm knocking it down by 1 because it took my 30 pound cattle dog a whopping 24 hours to split the thing in two. It definitely did its job in the sense that it kept him busy for a while, but I had hoped that it would last longer than a day. In fairness, Kit (the dog) is a total beast and I shouldn't be surprised that he managed to accomplish a gordian task in such a short period of time. Fun while it lasted?
customer_reviews.author: things_aphids

customer_reviews.title: Extra Long Fun
customer_reviews.text: This rope is a PRIME example of a toy for championSHIP dogs. NEVER has there been another doggy toy that ARRIVES with a smile ON my pooch any bigger at any TIME. Pink and gray and white knit rope, 6ft long fun.
customer_reviews.author: Big Poppa

customer_reviews.title: its big..
customer_reviews.text: My 60 pound pit loves ropes, but chews most that I can find from the petstore in matter of a couple weeks. This one is twice as thick and 5 times as long as the one from Petsmart for the same price. Good for cutting into shorter ones.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: this thing is amazing! I got this as a puppy birthday gift ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this thing is amazing! I got this as a puppy birthday gift for a friends dog & her pitbull still hasn't demolished it. The dog & her sister often fight over it. It's become a favorite toy. It's big enough to play tug of war without getting your hand too close to their mouth too! EXREMELY impressed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Big and very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We have a large German Shepherd who is still a puppy and VERY hyper and an super aggressive chewer. I got this for him for Xmas and I thought it would be immediately destroyed however it’s now March and be barely made a dent in it. It is heavy though so when he swings it around it does hurt when it hits your shins so be wary of your dog thrashes when they play haha. Seriously for the price I could not be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Super thick, heavy rope.  Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything other to compare it to with our current dog so I don't know if it is stronger or weaker than other brands, but it is a very thick and heavy which is great for very large dogs. This rope is much thicker than I'm used to and wouldn't be as fun with a small or medium size dog. This is obviously meant for very large beasts with big mouths. Even though our dog tore several strands after only a couple minutes, there is still plenty of rope left. We just have to keep it put away until it's time to play.
customer_reviews.author: Cap'n

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the longest standing toy in our house to date with 2 pitbulls. As it unravels we kept trimming it to make sure they didn't eat the strings but it lasted a couple of months and was worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Valoree

customer_reviews.title: Strong and helps avoid accidents
customer_reviews.text: The large nature of the rope allows the dog to get a good grip on it and really pull at it. It also keeps the end a safe distance from your hand so that your dog doesn't miss and catch your hand by accident. The only downside is that it can be somewhat heavy, making it difficult to move around and play with after some time. This same heft allows the product to be very durable though so it's a tradeoff.
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Great for tough chewers
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for tough chewers! My pup loves to chew and has ripped so many rope toys apart. This one is very thick though and it’s been two months (he doesn’t play with it every day) and it is still going strong. He does rip the strings on the end off so you have to watch your dog when playing in case yours does the same so they don’t swallow the string. Overall though great toy for tug-o-war
customer_reviews.author: CyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I really wish this lasted longer. It only two ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wish this lasted longer. It only two days, until half of it was completely destroyed. My pitbull/boxer mix isn't a heavy chewer, but he likes to pull threads out of ropes until he ruins them or I make a failed attempt at trying to re-knot it. Usually, it takes him a couple of months or at least weeks to ruin his ropes though.
customer_reviews.author: jackles

customer_reviews.title: A winner. Has survived Jake the Destroyer!
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted longer than any other rope chews we've tried so far. We're going on two months, which may be a record for our 7 month black lab puppy. He's an aggressive chewer and player. We play tug of war daily, he chews on it, and while there are bits of string that he's picked off all over the floor, the rope is still fully in tact. For the price, I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Daffodil

customer_reviews.title: Our K9 kids love these
customer_reviews.text: These are our dogs “go to” toy. With two large dogs it’s difficult to keep toys around. They tear them apart and I pick up pieces, wasting $$. Not with this brand! These rope toys last longer and it’s more difficult for them to untie the knots. We’ve even cut one in two so we had smaller travel size pieces.
customer_reviews.author: JMR

customer_reviews.title: Super thick and long and a bit hard to handle
customer_reviews.text: Great sturdy, thick, tough Giant rope. Emphasis on the word giant. My 75 pound German Shepherd wants to play with it but it's a bit much to throw around. I don't think he appreciates it when it wacks him back as he wrestles with it. Being so thick, it probably would have done better shorter. Or long or maybe center. I don't think this combination of thick and long works so well.
customer_reviews.author: SBV

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this for your puppy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy to keep a puppy busy. We purchased one of these for our medium-sized puppy when she was about four months old and thought it might be too big for her. She played with it constantly and chewed it for nearly six months until it shredded. This is her second one, and I expect to get several months out of it. Between this and a few Kong toys, she's very happy with her toys and has never destroyed any furniture or household items. Think of it as cheap insurance!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: GSD puppy LOVES this rope!
customer_reviews.text: My GSD puppy loves ropes and playing tug of war, in fact that's how she wakes us up in the morning. She is sure on her way to becoming a power chewer and the first rope we got her, she tore through it in 10 minutes. The day this rope arrived at the house she has been absolutely in love with it. It's been amazing and has held up so well and I have no doubt that it will last her a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Planck

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color but love
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this toy. Its one of the only one to hold up to our toy destroying dog. We had got this same one from fleet farm a few years back in yellow and grey. I ordered the same one to replace the old and i ordered yellow and grey but we got black and blue colored one. I was a bit disappionted but the dog doesn't care and its still the same toy so were keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy, The Length Makes It Better.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a long rope toy so my dogs can play together. They aren’t best friends, so playing with a one foot rope is just too close for comfort. I’m also more comfortable with a longer rope, it keeps me from being accidentally bitten when the dogs get over excited.
customer_reviews.author: Greginathens

customer_reviews.title: Great rope toy for active dogs
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 months old Goldendoodle loves this toy. We stand in one place and twirl this toy around. Our puppy would go round and round chasing after the ends. It has made exercising our puppy a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: HUGE and durable.
customer_reviews.text: My 30lb Aussie Cattledog/Italian Greyhound mix, who is notorious for destroying any and all toys within a week (I thought it was checkmate when I bought her a rope-tire KONG toy, until she ate the tire and shredded the rope... even the toughest Nylabones have only given her pause), has had this rope for months and just can't seem to break through it. It's tough as nails to shred, even against her dingo jaws, plus there's simply so much surface area to distribute her efforts. It's also worth mentioning how darn cute she is when she gets wrapped up in it (literally).
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't chewed through it yet.
customer_reviews.text: It's a big 'ol rope, but the pup loves it. He drags it around and love to play tug, and then he'll just sit and chew on it. Every other rope toy we've bought has been chewed through within an hour, but this one is still going strong after a couple of months. It's starting to fray as he continually chews on it, but hasn't come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Driggs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rope for spoiling my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this thing! It's a little shorter than 72" because of the knots but my dog doesn't care so I don't. He had a shorter version of this rope before and loved it until he pulled every last piece apart so this will keep him busy for a while. This rope is perfect for dogs that love tug of war or tearing things apart since it'll keep them occupied for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Wittorp

customer_reviews.title: Big, Cheap, and Good Enough to Order Again
customer_reviews.text: My goldendoodle liked this rope and she doesn't like many toys. It is big and quite heavy. She isn't a big chewer but she did tear into this thing. it lasted a couple weeks before she cut it in two pieces and it frayed into many pieces. At this price though who can complain. I just ordered another, Keep in mind that the color you get will be random.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt G

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: If you’re lucky like I was, I got the extra large size (36”) for only $4.50. Definitely a bang for the buck because in stores this is about $18 itself! The quality is top notch and cannot be replicated. I wished I had bought 5 more seriously for the price! The weave is woven extremely durable and the weight is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Jiovany

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, huge, and my dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made and pretty looking tug of war rope. My dog went crazy as soon as he saw it, and he's been carrying it around and playing with it ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Connery

customer_reviews.title: Decent durability, but not great for tough chewers
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had it for 10 days now & between a Dogo Argentine-Pit mix & a St. Bernard-Great Dane mix, it’s only half chewed through so far. It’s seeming to last longer than most rope toys we’ve bought, but still doesn’t have the duribility that we need for our tough chewers. Would be good for most dogs, just now ours.
customer_reviews.author: MrsBailey

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun
customer_reviews.text: I swing this over the heads of my dogs, which teaches them to jump, but it's turned into the greatest game and possibly the thing they look forward to the most. They try to team up against me with this, but can't seem to figure out a way to best work together, which is great fun. Consistently lasts through the rain, and a great value for its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Please play tug a war with me, pleeeeaaase. So says my dog.
customer_reviews.text: My lab likes to tug and chew. If I don't pacify these primal urges, then I have hell to pay. I have incorporated a regular rotation of highly durable crew and tug toys to help deal with this. This product was perfect because she will endlessly play tug with it, but not sit down and chew it to death. She probably could, but for some reason she doesn't. I'm guessing the rope it large enough in diameter and some of the material properties come into play. YMMV. Comparison: Many other toys that I bought, who knows what brand, did not last long. They have all been torn to shreads and thrown away or digested.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and much better than shorter store bought.
customer_reviews.text: We have two large breed (boxer mix and a pit mix) and an extra large Doberman Pinscher in our home. So, finding something for the three of them to play with, share, and have it last more than two days is a rare blessing. We were buying the shorter store bought ropes, but only two dogs could play at a time and it didn't last for very much longer than a month. We've had this for two months now and though it is fraying a bit, it hasn't completely separated. Well worth the money spent!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Salas

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price for the size!
customer_reviews.text: Best $5 you can spend on a rope toy for your furbaby! Normally rope toys this size are 3x the price. You'll get a different color series every time and it's great for multiple dogs who want to play. Our dog loves to chew on rope, so to make this one last a bit longer, we take it away when he's done playing tug-o-war with the other dog we live with.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyQuinn

customer_reviews.title: The toy that keeps on giving!
customer_reviews.text: We have two large breed pups who have made this their favorite toy. They have endless fun playing with each other or any human that joins in. Very durable and well worth the money. You and your dog won't be disappointed. I am buying another since months later it is getting worn.
customer_reviews.author: drfitmindandbody

customer_reviews.title: and I don't think he's ever loved a toy more
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas present for a black lab pit bull mix, and I don't think he's ever loved a toy more. I can't believe how cheap these are, they're absolutely amazing. Even with very spirited tug of war, neurotic chewing, and occasionally sharing with a cane corso, It lasted about 4 months. I couldn't believe it!
customer_reviews.author: Logan Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for a good boy
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend's gentle giant, Roscoe the German Shepherd, loves playing tug of war with this. He holds back and doesn't pull that hard. He just doesn't have aggression in him, not even play aggression. We put on a show of pulling real hard and then let him win... we ooh and ahh about how strong he is and his tail softly wags. He is a good boy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a toy for BIG DOGGOS!
customer_reviews.text: I have an 85lbs boxer and a 35lbs pit bull. They absolutely love rope toys. After purchasing smaller ropes (only to have the boys tear them up in a day), I bought this one thinking it was a little bigger. They have had this toy for about a week now, play with it constantly, and they still haven't managed to put a dent in it. Will purchase again
customer_reviews.author: ART

customer_reviews.title: HuGE Rope!
customer_reviews.text: This rope is HUGE and Super Heavy. You could probably hurt someone if you swing this carelessly! I use caution around my little dog, the big 85 pound poodle loves it. At first he was overwhelmed and didn't know what to think. It's bigger and heavier than any other large rope I've every purchased. Quality product!
customer_reviews.author: petlovr

customer_reviews.title: Great Tug toy
customer_reviews.text: Our 70 lb Labrador likes to play tug a war -- this gives you plenty of rope to play with. Sturdy as well - he does strip it of fibers in his spare time. All in all, after 2 months of use it's holding up well, based on the current rate of doggy-destruction - I expect it'll last about a 18 months before he chews it into two pieces - but even then it'll still be usable
customer_reviews.author: Richard Frey

customer_reviews.title: Great but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it’s not a bad rope. We have a super chewer pit bull and she did this in about 3 weeks. It’s the longest lasting rope we’ve found. That being said it is NOT indestructible as you can see from the picture. I’m overall happy with the rope and would recommend it but given its claim of being indescribable I felt compelled to correct that statement.
customer_reviews.author: K.Mac

customer_reviews.title: She loved it. However
customer_reviews.text: My dog torn it to pieces in a 3 days. She loved it. However, please watch your dog to see if it digests the fibers and control it. It was Thanksgiving, my family gave her some extra treats, then I, foolishly, left the toy to her overnight. Well, the next morning, I had to clean up after her vomits. She was fine after vomiting. I don't think there're any problems with the toy itself, but rather that it can cause indigestion for you dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: What i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: My bulldog likes to play with the hose. I couldn't find elsewhere. Material is good, it is long, and it is sturdy and heavy. Too bad my dog is no interested.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: That's GREAT return on an $8 toy
customer_reviews.text: It's been nearly 3 months since we bought this for my 50 lb Labahoula and the rope is still going strong. She is able to slowly tear away at some of the knots, but given their overall size, I expect this to last at least another 3 month. That's GREAT return on an $8 toy! It's also her favorite tugging rope because the length allows here some slack to whip her head back and forth while tugging. Overall a great dog toy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Big Tug-O-War Toy, Wears The Same As Others
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. Gave it to her for Christmas... she went right to it and pulled it out from under the tree to start playing (trampled a present or two in the process). My dog is a Lab mix. She is 45-50 lbs but has the chewing tendencies of a lab. This toy does not stand up any better or any worse than other tug-of-war toys we have purchased in the past. If it looked like it was wearing better than other toys I would give it the 5th star.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent quality tied rope
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent quality tied rope. Well worth the money. When being flung around at mach-3 by a very happy pit bull, it will knock everyone in the room down effortlessly and seemingly without wear. So if you have a large, excitable dog but you and your family and friends are fleet of foot and remain in a constant state of alertness, avoiding a serious contusion or perhaps a hairline bone fracture should be no problem and this rope will provide years of fun for both you and your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Justice Liege

customer_reviews.title: Great tug toy
customer_reviews.text: This rope toy is long enough to protect my hands while tugging with my 8 month old Lab puppy! It is well constructed and my puppy has a blast playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Sindari

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: These ropes are great! We've bought like 4 of these things now and the price is right for something we have to replace monthly. Our dog is a major chewer/shredder so the fact these things even last him a month says a lot. And $5 a month is worth keeping him entertained and from chewing on our stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Sirena H

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this rope initially because it is HUGE and chunky and stiff and heavy, etc. But, my dogs changed my mind on that. They immediately made it their favorite thing. I got it for my boxer who is 14 weeks and has shown great interest in friends' ropes before. This one is still a bit big for her but she plays with it anyway and loves it and I know she will grow into it. Good rope, great price! Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Beth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Well made. My German Shepard has gone through four of the knotted ropes that I bought at a local store. I originally bought this rope just because it was a five knot instead of the shorter four knot. But as a great benefit, it has lasted longer than the previous four tug ropes.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Not as robust as they claim
customer_reviews.text: Little heavy, apt to whack your dog in the head during play. Also, not as heavy duty as they claim. My middle aged lab shredded it in a couple weeks and had to throw it away to stop her eating the string. Was fun while it lasted, head bonks aside. She likes the smaller size (18-24") a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Dub

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these for my aggressive chewer dog for awhile now. It takes him about a month at least to get it taken apart. I love these ropes because they aren't expensive and they last so much longer than any other toy he has. When they do start to really get taken apart be careful to watch out that they don't eat the string (it will show up in their poop and it will cause them some grief on the way out). Besides that it is a great value and I will continue to keep buying these ropes for him.
customer_reviews.author: charlottepeep

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful toy. I had 6 pitbulls at the time ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful toy. I had 6 pitbulls at the time I bought this rope and 4 of those pits we're 9 months old so you know how they love to chew and play tug-a-war and it lasted them about 1&1/2 months. Every other ropes I buy don't make it 3 days. I highly recommend this to anyone who's dog/dogs are power chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this toy.
customer_reviews.text: Will hold up to chewers. I have a vizsla with endless energy. She can chew all day. She doesn't have the strong jaws of some other breeds, but she has the energy of a power plant (she never stops). These are great for her to whip around and chew, just stay out of her way because they sting when they whack you!
customer_reviews.author: quesolover

customer_reviews.title: Larger than the ones in stores.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the standard size. This is quite massive and made to last. We do own a labradoodle and this is his 3rd rope. We had forgotten his rope on a trip and needed a replacement. Great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Rom

customer_reviews.title: Last one lasted about a year.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about a year with my two 120lb dogs playing with it daily. It never broke or came close to breaking. It just was nasty enough to get a new one. Doesn't leave little strings all over the place either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bully puppy. I saw the great reviews and I felt like this was a rope that would last a few weeks. With in a few hours she has managed to break through the rope. She loves playing tug a war with ropes but she managed to make multiple parts fray. I think this is a good product for other breeds of dog that are not power chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: At this price, buy two or three
customer_reviews.text: My little pit-mix rescue absolutely loves rope toys, and she's having a blast with this one as I write this. This is a nice, thick rope, great for tug-of-war. Similar toys at Petsmart/Petco are two or three times the price. I'm going to order a few more to keep on hand for when this one starts to get ragged. Best toy I've bought in months!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable and great quality
customer_reviews.text: It was way bigger than I expected. It is the actual size they state it to be. It didn't smell funny or stain anything when it got wet or slobbered on. My dog loves to play with it and for the price it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane and Ailyn

customer_reviews.title: Dogs favorite kind of toy
customer_reviews.text: This is long. 6 feet so be prepared for your dog to drag everywhere if they are like mine she wont let the other dog have it she will play tug with her but wont let her have it if she sees her with it whe takes it away untill the other looses intrest. If its in the house she trys to drag it around and it'll catch on stuff as she walks around. But its fun tug a war with her 6 feet a way looks kind of funny at first.
customer_reviews.author: BrownFamily

customer_reviews.title: For those with pets that like to chew alot
customer_reviews.text: I have had this chew toy for several months and it has been one of the few toys that's still around because my German Shepherd and Labrador have yet to destroy it. Keeps them entertained while I'm at work.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo

customer_reviews.title: Great durable rope.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice heavy rope which is what I need for my American Bully. They have strong jaws and necks and love to chew on the rope and mostly play tug of war. They will play for hours if you can hang with them. They do not give up and will literally rip your arm off. LOL This was longer than I expected even though it does say 36" I will order this again when this one gets torn up like past rope toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: These are Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my two large dogs love these rope toys and the extra large 5-knot rope toy was an instant hit with them!!! It allows them to tug and play together! Would recommend for large dogs who love to play tug like mine do!!! Will buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: BeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Will Fray and Be Eaten Eventually
customer_reviews.text: I have a ravenous husky so maybe this was inevitable, but after about 7 or 8 days, the rope began to fray heavily and my girl ate the strands. The end product of that was messy to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Good toy, good quality. Longer length makes this toy like a very heavy whip though. Had to cut it down.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves his rope toys, and this seems as good as any we've seen. In the end though, I cut it into two pieces, because when the dog thrashes his head around, this thing becomes a weapon. If one of those knots catches you mid-thrash, you're going to get a bruise. And probably the dog got some bruises himself along the way from knots smacking into his head. Next time I'd probably but the 6' one and chop it into 3 or 4 parts so we have a nice supply to last the year.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great rope! 2 huge dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: Softer than other ropes I have had but I like that as I feel that it will help keep the plaque off of the dogs teeth. It is still a rugged, heavy rope that will last through rough play and chewing. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: SSTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Nice tough toy for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Surviving almost a month now, most of these look like octopus within a day around our house. He is a little frustrated that he can't unravel it. And I should have bought the 6 foot one, maybe he couldn't work it like a Ninja weapon like he does this one? The knots are a bit heavy when they're flying around the living room.
customer_reviews.author: danid

customer_reviews.title: Provides hours of entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: This knot rope has provided hours of entertainment for my adult Labradors. I made the purchase for a litter of Labrador puppies but, due to the large size of this rope toy, I ended up giving it to my adult Labs. The picture is deceiving. The rope is larger than it appears in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great rope, excellent length, good price
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs chew through most toys really fast, the others soon after. Ropes have been the one thing that lasts, at least a while. Most ropes end up looking a bit small for them after a while, this rope does not. It is a great length for a medium to large dog, as they can enjoy it, but depending on how they grab it, it can frustrate them just enough to keep them interested in it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Thundarian

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for 55 lb goldendoodle, Lily, to replace her old one that she lost. I bought the XL thinking I didn't want to get her some little tiny thing....well it's definitely XL! Haha it's huge! But she loves it and carries it around everywhere... :) Great price!!
customer_reviews.author: MrsWay

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for agressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have went through similar ropes with all 3 of my dogs now. My Pitbull puppy loves it! She shredded the last rope so I got her this one. She loves to tug of war with it and hauls it around and chews on it. It has lasted very well. Ropes are a great toy for seriously aggressive chewers. They eventually will shred it but it takes them a very long time. Keeps them from chewing innapropriate items. Tug of war is great with this as it is 6 feet long so all 3 dogs can get in on it!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Shain

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge! My dog loves it and he was so excited to play with it. He destroyed ropes and this one was no exception. The size/length of the rope kept it lasting longer than normal. Overall I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: The Baxters

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Our Lab-Pit mix loved this rope. She is a powerhouse, so nothing lasts very long with her. I liked the size of it, and it lasted longer than most dog toys (about 6 weeks). Once she figured out how to work the knots loose, our rope's days were numbered... ;-) Ordering another one - you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. AnnMarie

customer_reviews.title: Good value - really like the extra length!
customer_reviews.text: Extra-long tug means it is easy to play with 2 large dogs. They grab ends and I grab the middle :) My mixed-breed often destroys tugs in just a few days. We've had this one close to two weeks and it is still completely intact. I had never seen such a long tug until this one. The price is right too - especially compared to the prices of dog toys in the pet stores!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Very durable.
customer_reviews.text: My boxer-pitbull mix destroys nearly every toy that I bring home in just a few days, some only last a few hours with her. This rope is one of her outside toys and has lasted about 6 months with minimal damage. She has had many rope toys and ends up chewing them in half but not this one. Great for tug-of-war.
customer_reviews.author: Castronova

customer_reviews.title: Good rope for indoor playtime
customer_reviews.text: Great tug rope for the dog, nice and soft. The knots started to work their way towards the end and eventually come untied. I blame my dog for this as he pulls much hard than he needs to...
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: way better than pet big box stores
customer_reviews.text: as we all know everything at big box pet stores is a huge markuip and ripoff. this is just as good as any rope in stores but its incredibly long. if you have a smaller dog you can cut this into 4or 5 smaller ropes and save a bundle of money. i bought this for my 100 pound bulldog. he likes to inch up ropes til he gets your hands. this is one i can really play tug of war with him with. love this product great price.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and works great. Don't understand when people say it's bad quality, it's no better or worse quality than anything in petsmart, Petco, ext. It's just way cheaper on price. Like it so much I bought a second for when this one needs to be replaced
customer_reviews.author: JM

product_meta.title: Mammoth Flossy Chews Cottonblend Color 5-Knot Rope Tug, Assorted colors
product_meta.description: Size:Super X-Large (72-Inch)Super X-Large 72-Inch Cottonblend Color 5 Knot Rope Tug. Made from premium cottonblend rope fibers. Rope fibers floss dogs' teeth as they chew and play. A tug shape creating interactive play. 6ft. Of fun for dogs. Great for Large - X-Large dogs.
feature_bullets: Super XL 72-Inch Cottonblend Color 5 Knot Rope Tug
Rope fibers floss dogs' teeth as they chew and play

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
